becxa_s: I love and appreciate opening up my Insta and seeing you rock your "perfectly imperfect" body. But there is nothing imperfect the way I see it. Your beautiful and absolutely inspiring. I am only 19 and was diagnosed with an autoimmune thyroiditis or Hashimotos and it has caused me to gain weight. All my life I was the slim tall girl, the skinny of me and my sister. littlepinkstarsally: Having previously been a 6/8 and extremely active with a flat tummy I'm struggling with my new 10/12 body and curved and sticky out stoma. j_rex_gaming: Thank you for sharing this. You are such an inspiration. I believe we all have scars. Some are physical and some are mental/emotional. I also believe that it really helps to talk about them and get them out in the open. So, again, thank you for sharing and being open about this.
sablowe: In 2016 I had two major ops and ended up with a 15cm scar across my stomach. I was always pretty content with my figure. It wasn’t perfect but wasn’t terrible. People seemed to think it was okay to say this and didn’t realise that prior to them bringing it up it didn’t actually cross my mind. I now wear bikini etc and don’t care about it. Even tho people still ask directly (eg at the gym or on honeymoon). Nice to see this post as I did a similar thing yesterday
